meanings.definition: The quality or state of including or being included within a group or structure.
meanings.sent1: The school promotes inclusiveness by organizing events for all students to participate.
meanings.sent2: Inclusiveness is important in creating a welcoming environment for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The party had an unexpected twist of inclusiveness when even the shyest guest joined the dance.
meanings.sent4: Her speech had an aura of inclusiveness that made everyone feel valued and heard.
meanings.sent5: The inclusiveness of the team made working together feel like a supportive family.

meanings.definition: The practice or policy of including people who might otherwise be excluded or marginalized.
meanings.sent1: The company's inclusiveness led to a diverse and innovative workforce.
meanings.sent2: Inclusiveness ensures that everyone has a fair chance to contribute their ideas.
meanings.sent3: The inclusiveness of the club extended even to the most unlikely members, creating a sense of unity.
meanings.sent4: His leadership style embraced inclusiveness, making sure no voice was left unheard.
meanings.sent5: The inclusiveness of the community project brought together people from all walks of life.
